intro: Zwingera bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored zwingera, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking bicolor flowers, which typically display a combination of white and purple hues. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. Zwingera bicolor thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude grasslands. Its unique coloration and ecological significance make it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists alike.
